concept.title: GCSYMMETRIC Command
concept.shortdesc: Constrains a symmetric geometric constraint on 2D entities.

conbody.p: Create a symmetric constraint to ensure two entities remain symmetric with respect to a selected line.

section.title: Methods to create a symmetric constraint
section.p:
There are two methods to begin creating a symmetric constraint:
Select first entity
2Points

dlentry.dd: Begin creating a symmetric constraint by selecting a 2D entity then:
Select an entity to make symmetric to the first entity then:
Select a line to act as a mirror line between the two entities. The first entity maintains its position while the second entity adjusts, as necessary, to become symmetric about that line.
Begin creating a symmetric constraint by selecting a valid point on a 2D entity then:
Select a second valid point on a 2D entity to make symmetric with the first point.
Select a line to act as a mirror line between the two entities. The first point maintains its position while the second point adjusts, as necessary, to become symmetric about that line.
